description.narrative: Assessment of Project Outcomes - Stakeholder effects: Increased access to finance for SMEs Through the Project, IFC expects that Equity BCDC will expand its SME portfolio from US$250 mln in 2021 to US$631 mln by 2026, representing a growth rate of 141% compared to 2021. Equity-BCDC will use IFCs de-risking instrument and advisory support to grow its SME portfolio in relative terms with a projected increase of the SME share of the Banks overall loan book from 24% to 35% over the next five years - Stakeholder effects: increased access to finance for WSMEs - Over the project life cycle, the Bank expects to increase its WSME lending from US$22 mln in 2021 to US$70 mln by 2026, representing a relative portfolio growth as a share of the SME portfolio from 9 percent to 11 percent. Assessment of Contribution to Market Creation - Competitiveness The Project supports the expansion of Equity-BCDCs SME finance business through an integrated IS/AS approach that is expected to serve as a meaningful market signal.

The project consists of an up to US$25 million risk sharing facility (RSF) providing a 50% loss coverage for up to US$50 million SME loan portfolio originated by Equity Banque Commerciale du Congo (Equity BCDC or the Bank) (The Project). The team expects the RSF to be complemented by advisory services aimed at strengthening the Bank's holistic Risk Management Framework, SME origination, underwriting, monitoring and credit risk management capabilities. The Project will be committed in two separate tranches.
